result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: test was performed at a voltage of 0 V. The experiment was carried out in an 80 mL closed quartz reactor.Generally, 20 mg catalyst was placed in the reactor, 100 L of deionized water was added, and the mixture of catalyst powder and water was stirred to spread the powder evenly onto the bottom of the reactor in order to maximize the interaction area with CO 2 .Then, the reactor was purged with CO 2 for 30 min to remove the other gases.After that, the reaction was carried out under the irradiation of a 300

from CO 2 reduction rather than from the catalyst itself or factors of the reactor, control experiments either in N 2 atmosphere or in the absence of catalyst is carried out, as shown in Fig. S3.No CO or CH 4 is detected, proving that the product is indeed due to the photocatalytic reaction.The effect of the size of CNtb on the photocatalytic performance is further investigated.As shown in Fig S4 , for sample CNtbNS (pure CNtb is treated under sonication without adding GDY under the same conditions with

the photo-generated holes are more inclined to transfer from CNtb to GDY, and oxidize H 2 O adsorbed giving rise to O 2 .At the same time, the photogenerated electrons stay at the conduction band of CNtb, react with CO 2 to generate CO and CH 4 with the assistance of proton.This effective charge transfer significantly promotes the separation efficiency of photo-generated carriers 50 as evidenced by the PL and photocurrent spectra.In addition, it can also be seen from EIS Nyquist plots that the introduction

by the ThermoFisher ESCALAB 250 spectrometer.Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectra was performed on a NEXUS 670 spectrometer, the scanning range is 400-4000 cm -1 .The surface potential of the samples was determined by measuring the Zeta potential (Zetasizer Nano ZS ZEN3600). The photoelectrochemical properties of the samples were investigated using an electrochemical workstation (CHI660E C18532, Chen Hua Instrument Co., Ltd.Shanghai), with platinum wire and AgAgCl (in saturated KCl) as the counter

terms of CO 2 reduction under visible light irradiation.First of all, it can be seen from Fig. 5a-b that the introduction of GDY can significantly improve the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction efficiency and CO and CH 4 are the main products.At the same time, nearly no H 2 was detected, which may be due to the low amount.In addition, the CO 2 reduction activity of GDYCNtb increases gradually with increasing the content of GDY, which reaches the highest when the mass ratio of GDY to CNtb is 0.07.Specifically,

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: under the irradiation of a 300 W Xe lamp equipped with a 420 nm filter.0.5 mL of gas was extracted from the reactor every 1 h.CO and CH 4 were measured by a GC-7920 gas chromatograph (equipped with FID detector and N 2 as carrier gas), and H 2 was measured by a GC-7806 gas chromatograph (equipped with TCD detector and Ar as carrier gas).

electron microscope (JEM-2100F).UV-vis diffuse reflection absorption (DRS) is measured by Shimadzu UV-2600 spectrophotometer equipped with an integrating sphere using BaSO 4 as the reference.The photoluminescence spectra (PL) are obtained by fluorescence spectrometer (FLS-980).The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) surface areas of the samples were measured by a Micromeritics ASAP Kubo X1000 analyzer at liquid nitrogen temperature.The X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were obtained by the ThermoFisher ESCALAB

saturated KCl) as the counter electrode and reference electrode, respectively, and phosphate buffer solution as the electrolyte.Usually, 1 mg of sample powder is dispersed into 1 mL of isopropanol solution, 10 L of Nafion solution is added, and then the mixture is sonicated for 3 h.50 L of above mixed solution was dripcoated onto a 1 1 cm FTO sheet, and form a working electrode after drying.The photocurrent test was performed at a constant voltage of 0.7 V, and the impedance test was performed at a voltage
